subject: Sales
title: Three Stages of Buying
description: A micro-lesson that makes Three Stages of Buying usable.

hook.text: Nobody wakes up wanting to buy software. They wake up with a problem. Buying is the last resort.

buildup.text: Every purchase follows three stages: awareness, consideration, and decision.

discovery.text: Most sellers pitch too early. They offer solutions before the buyer has even named the problem.

twist.text: Great content marketing matches each stage. Education first, pitch last.

climax.text: Meet buyers where they are, not where you want them to be. Timing beats talent in sales.

punchline.text: Sell to the stage, not just the person.

quiz.question: What are the three stages of the buyer's journey?
